{{Infobox figure skater |name= Steve Hartsell |image= |caption= |country= [[United States]] |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1978|1|6}} |birth_place= [[Ann Arbor]], [[Michigan]], [[United States]] |residence= |height= |partner= |formerpartner= [[Danielle Hartsell]]
[[Marcy Hinzmann]] and [[Kristen Roth]] |coach= |formercoach= |choreographer= |formerchoreographer= |skating club= |retired= |medaltemplates= {{MedalCountry| [[United States]]}} {{MedalSport | Pairs' [[Figure skating]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Four Continents Figure Skating Championships|Four Continents Championships]]}} {{MedalBronze| [[1999 Four Continents Figure Skating Championships|1999 Halifax]]|Pairs}} }} '''Steve Hartsell''' (born January 6, 1978, [[Ann Arbor, Michigan]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[pair skater]]. With sister [[Danielle Hartsell]], he is the 1999 [[U.S. Figure Skating Championships|U.S. National Champion]] and the 1997 World Junior Champion. After his sister retired, he skated with [[Marcy Hinzmann]] and [[Kristen Roth]]. ==Results== Men's Singles {| class="wikitable" |- !
